Files

simple_logger/
lib.rs

1//! A logger that prints all messages with a simple, readable output format.
2//!
3//! Optional features include timestamps, colored output and logging to stderr.
4//!
5//! ```rust
6//! simple_logger::SimpleLogger::new().env().init().unwrap();
7//!
8//! log::warn!("This is an example message.");
9//! ```
10//!
11//! Some shortcuts are available for common use cases.
12//!
13//! Just initialize logging without any configuration:
14//!
15//! ```rust
16//! simple_logger::init().unwrap();
17//! ```
18//!
19//! Set the log level from the `RUST_LOG` environment variable:
20//!
21//! ```rust
22//! simple_logger::init_with_env().unwrap();
23//! ```
24//!
25//! Hardcode a default log level:
26//!
27//! ```rust
28//! simple_logger::init_with_level(log::Level::Warn).unwrap();
29//! ```
30
31#![cfg_attr(feature = "nightly", feature(thread_id_value))]
32
33#[cfg(feature = "colors")]
34use colored::*;
35use log::{Level, LevelFilter, Log, Metadata, Record, SetLoggerError};
36use std::{collections::HashMap, str::FromStr};
37#[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
38use time::{format_description::FormatItem, OffsetDateTime, UtcOffset};
39
40#[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
41const TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_OFFSET: &[FormatItem] = time::macros::format_description!(
42    "[year]-[month]-[day]T[hour]:[minute]:[second].[subsecond digits:3][offset_hour sign:mandatory]:[offset_minute]"
43);
44
45#[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
46const TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_UTC: &[FormatItem] =
47    time::macros::format_description!("[year]-[month]-[day]T[hour]:[minute]:[second].[subsecond digits:3]Z");
48
49#[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
50#[derive(PartialEq)]
51enum Timestamps {
52    None,
53    Local,
54    Utc,
55    UtcOffset(UtcOffset),
56}
57
58/// Implements [`Log`] and a set of simple builder methods for configuration.
59///
60/// Use the various "builder" methods on this struct to configure the logger,
61/// then call [`init`] to configure the [`log`] crate.
62pub struct SimpleLogger {
63    /// The default logging level
64    default_level: LevelFilter,
65
66    /// The specific logging level for each module
67    ///
68    /// This is used to override the default value for some specific modules.
69    ///
70    /// This must be sorted from most-specific to least-specific, so that [`enabled`](#method.enabled) can scan the
71    /// vector for the first match to give us the desired log level for a module.
72    module_levels: Vec<(String, LevelFilter)>,
73
74    /// Whether to include thread names (and IDs) or not
75    ///
76    /// This field is only available if the `threads` feature is enabled.
77    #[cfg(feature = "threads")]
78    threads: bool,
79
80    /// Control how timestamps are displayed.
81    ///
82    /// This field is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
83    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
84    timestamps: Timestamps,
85    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
86    timestamps_format: Option<&'static [FormatItem<'static>]>,
87
88    /// Whether to use color output or not.
89    ///
90    /// This field is only available if the `color` feature is enabled.
91    #[cfg(feature = "colors")]
92    colors: bool,
93}
94
95impl SimpleLogger {
96    /// Initializes the global logger with a SimpleLogger instance with
97    /// default log level set to `Level::Trace`.
98    ///
99    /// ```no_run
100    /// use simple_logger::SimpleLogger;
101    /// SimpleLogger::new().env().init().unwrap();
102    /// log::warn!("This is an example message.");
103    /// ```
104    ///
105    /// [`init`]: #method.init
106    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
107    pub fn new() -> SimpleLogger {
108        SimpleLogger {
109            default_level: LevelFilter::Trace,
110            module_levels: Vec::new(),
111
112            #[cfg(feature = "threads")]
113            threads: false,
114
115            #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
116            timestamps: Timestamps::Utc,
117
118            #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
119            timestamps_format: None,
120
121            #[cfg(feature = "colors")]
122            colors: true,
123        }
124    }
125
126    /// Initializes the global logger with log level read from `RUST_LOG` environment
127    /// variable value. Deprecated in favor of `env()`.
128    ///
129    /// You may use the various builder-style methods on this type to configure
130    /// the logger, and you must call [`init`] in order to start logging messages.
131    ///
132    /// ```no_run
133    /// use simple_logger::SimpleLogger;
134    /// SimpleLogger::from_env().init().unwrap();
135    /// log::warn!("This is an example message.");
136    /// ```
137    ///
138    /// [`init`]: #method.init
139    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
140    #[deprecated(
141        since = "1.12.0",
142        note = "Use [`env`](#method.env) instead. Will be removed in version 2.0.0."
143    )]
144    pub fn from_env() -> SimpleLogger {
145        SimpleLogger::new().with_level(log::LevelFilter::Error).env()
146    }
147
148    /// Enables the user to choose log level by setting `RUST_LOG=<level>`
149    /// environment variable. This will use the default level set by
150    /// [`with_level`] if `RUST_LOG` is not set or can't be parsed as a
151    /// standard log level.
152    ///
153    /// This must be called after [`with_level`]. If called before
154    /// [`with_level`], it will have no effect.
155    ///
156    /// [`with_level`]: #method.with_level
157    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
158    pub fn env(mut self) -> SimpleLogger {
159        self.default_level = std::env::var("RUST_LOG")
160            .ok()
161            .as_deref()
162            .map(log::LevelFilter::from_str)
163            .and_then(Result::ok)
164            .unwrap_or(self.default_level);
165
166        self
167    }
168
169    /// Set the 'default' log level.
170    ///
171    /// You can override the default level for specific modules and their sub-modules using [`with_module_level`]
172    ///
173    /// This must be called before [`env`]. If called after [`env`], it will override the value loaded from the environment.
174    ///
175    /// [`env`]: #method.env
176    /// [`with_module_level`]: #method.with_module_level
177    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
178    pub fn with_level(mut self, level: LevelFilter) -> SimpleLogger {
179        self.default_level = level;
180        self
181    }
182
183    /// Override the log level for some specific modules.
184    ///
185    /// This sets the log level of a specific module and all its sub-modules.
186    /// When both the level for a parent module as well as a child module are set,
187    /// the more specific value is taken. If the log level for the same module is
188    /// specified twice, the resulting log level is implementation defined.
189    ///
190    /// # Examples
191    ///
192    /// Silence an overly verbose crate:
193    ///
194    /// ```no_run
195    /// use simple_logger::SimpleLogger;
196    /// use log::LevelFilter;
197    ///
198    /// SimpleLogger::new().with_module_level("chatty_dependency", LevelFilter::Warn).init().unwrap();
199    /// ```
200    ///
201    /// Disable logging for all dependencies:
202    ///
203    /// ```no_run
204    /// use simple_logger::SimpleLogger;
205    /// use log::LevelFilter;
206    ///
207    /// SimpleLogger::new()
208    ///     .with_level(LevelFilter::Off)
209    ///     .with_module_level("my_crate", LevelFilter::Info)
210    ///     .init()
211    ///     .unwrap();
212    /// ```
213    //
214    // This method *must* sort `module_levels` for the [`enabled`](#method.enabled) method to work correctly.
215    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
216    pub fn with_module_level(mut self, target: &str, level: LevelFilter) -> SimpleLogger {
217        self.module_levels.push((target.to_string(), level));
218        self.module_levels
219            .sort_by_key(|(name, _level)| name.len().wrapping_neg());
220        self
221    }
222
223    /// Override the log level for specific targets.
224    // This method *must* sort `module_levels` for the [`enabled`](#method.enabled) method to work correctly.
225    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
226    #[deprecated(
227        since = "1.11.0",
228        note = "Use [`with_module_level`](#method.with_module_level) instead. Will be removed in version 2.0.0."
229    )]
230    pub fn with_target_levels(mut self, target_levels: HashMap<String, LevelFilter>) -> SimpleLogger {
231        self.module_levels = target_levels.into_iter().collect();
232        self.module_levels
233            .sort_by_key(|(name, _level)| name.len().wrapping_neg());
234        self
235    }
236
237    /// Control whether thread names (and IDs) are printed or not.
238    ///
239    /// This method is only available if the `threads` feature is enabled.
240    /// Thread names are disabled by default.
241    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
242    #[cfg(feature = "threads")]
243    pub fn with_threads(mut self, threads: bool) -> SimpleLogger {
244        self.threads = threads;
245        self
246    }
247
248    /// Control whether timestamps are printed or not.
249    ///
250    /// Timestamps will be displayed in the local timezone.
251    ///
252    /// This method is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
253    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
254    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
255    #[deprecated(
256        since = "1.16.0",
257        note = "Use [`with_local_timestamps`] or [`with_utc_timestamps`] instead. Will be removed in version 2.0.0."
258    )]
259    pub fn with_timestamps(mut self, timestamps: bool) -> SimpleLogger {
260        if timestamps {
261            self.timestamps = Timestamps::Local
262        } else {
263            self.timestamps = Timestamps::None
264        }
265        self
266    }
267
268    /// Control the format used for timestamps.
269    ///
270    /// Without this, a default format is used depending on the timestamps type.
271    ///
272    /// The syntax for the format_description macro can be found in the
273    /// [`time` crate book](https://time-rs.github.io/book/api/format-description.html).
274    ///
275    /// ```
276    /// simple_logger::SimpleLogger::new()
277    ///  .with_level(log::LevelFilter::Debug)
278    ///  .env()
279    ///  .with_timestamp_format(time::macros::format_description!("[year]-[month]-[day] [hour]:[minute]:[second]"))
280    ///  .init()
281    ///  .unwrap();
282    /// ```
283    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
284    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
285    pub fn with_timestamp_format(mut self, format: &'static [FormatItem<'static>]) -> SimpleLogger {
286        self.timestamps_format = Some(format);
287        self
288    }
289
290    /// Don't display any timestamps.
291    ///
292    /// This method is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
293    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
294    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
295    pub fn without_timestamps(mut self) -> SimpleLogger {
296        self.timestamps = Timestamps::None;
297        self
298    }
299
300    /// Display timestamps using the local timezone.
301    ///
302    /// This method is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
303    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
304    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
305    pub fn with_local_timestamps(mut self) -> SimpleLogger {
306        self.timestamps = Timestamps::Local;
307        self
308    }
309
310    /// Display timestamps using UTC.
311    ///
312    /// This method is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
313    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
314    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
315    pub fn with_utc_timestamps(mut self) -> SimpleLogger {
316        self.timestamps = Timestamps::Utc;
317        self
318    }
319
320    /// Display timestamps using a static UTC offset.
321    ///
322    /// This method is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
323    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
324    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
325    pub fn with_utc_offset(mut self, offset: UtcOffset) -> SimpleLogger {
326        self.timestamps = Timestamps::UtcOffset(offset);
327        self
328    }
329
330    /// Control whether messages are colored or not.
331    ///
332    /// This method is only available if the `colored` feature is enabled.
333    #[must_use = "You must call init() to begin logging"]
334    #[cfg(feature = "colors")]
335    pub fn with_colors(mut self, colors: bool) -> SimpleLogger {
336        self.colors = colors;
337        self
338    }
339
340    /// Configure the logger
341    pub fn max_level(&self) -> LevelFilter {
342        let max_level = self.module_levels.iter().map(|(_name, level)| level).copied().max();
343        max_level
344            .map(|lvl| lvl.max(self.default_level))
345            .unwrap_or(self.default_level)
346    }
347
348    /// 'Init' the actual logger and instantiate it,
349    /// this method MUST be called in order for the logger to be effective.
350    pub fn init(self) -> Result<(), SetLoggerError> {
351        #[cfg(all(windows, feature = "colored"))]
352        set_up_windows_color_terminal();
353
354        #[cfg(all(feature = "colored", feature = "stderr"))]
355        use_stderr_for_colors();
356
357        log::set_max_level(self.max_level());
358        log::set_boxed_logger(Box::new(self))
359    }
360}
361
362impl Default for SimpleLogger {
363    /// See [this](struct.SimpleLogger.html#method.new)
364    fn default() -> Self {
365        SimpleLogger::new()
366    }
367}
368
369impl Log for SimpleLogger {
370    fn enabled(&self, metadata: &Metadata) -> bool {
371        &metadata.level().to_level_filter()
372            <= self
373                .module_levels
374                .iter()
375                /* At this point the Vec is already sorted so that we can simply take
376                 * the first match
377                 */
378                .find(|(name, _level)| metadata.target().starts_with(name))
379                .map(|(_name, level)| level)
380                .unwrap_or(&self.default_level)
381    }
382
383    fn log(&self, record: &Record) {
384        if self.enabled(record.metadata()) {
385            let level_string = {
386                #[cfg(feature = "colors")]
387                {
388                    if self.colors {
389                        match record.level() {
390                            Level::Error => format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string()).red().to_string(),
391                            Level::Warn => format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string()).yellow().to_string(),
392                            Level::Info => format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string()).cyan().to_string(),
393                            Level::Debug => format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string()).purple().to_string(),
394                            Level::Trace => format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string()).normal().to_string(),
395                        }
396                    } else {
397                        format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string())
398                    }
399                }
400                #[cfg(not(feature = "colors"))]
401                {
402                    format!("{:<5}", record.level().to_string())
403                }
404            };
405
406            let target = if !record.target().is_empty() {
407                record.target()
408            } else {
409                record.module_path().unwrap_or_default()
410            };
411
412            let thread = {
413                #[cfg(feature = "threads")]
414                if self.threads {
415                    let thread = std::thread::current();
416
417                    format!("@{}", {
418                        #[cfg(feature = "nightly")]
419                        {
420                            thread.name().unwrap_or(&thread.id().as_u64().to_string())
421                        }
422
423                        #[cfg(not(feature = "nightly"))]
424                        {
425                            thread.name().unwrap_or("?")
426                        }
427                    })
428                } else {
429                    "".to_string()
430                }
431
432                #[cfg(not(feature = "threads"))]
433                ""
434            };
435
436            let timestamp = {
437                #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
438                match self.timestamps {
439                    Timestamps::None => "".to_string(),
440                    Timestamps::Local => format!(
441                        "{} ",
442                        OffsetDateTime::now_local()
443                            .expect(concat!(
444                                "Could not determine the UTC offset on this system. ",
445                                "Consider displaying UTC time instead. ",
446                                "Possible causes are that the time crate does not implement \"local_offset_at\" ",
447                                "on your system, or that you are running in a multi-threaded environment and ",
448                                "the time crate is returning \"None\" from \"local_offset_at\" to avoid unsafe ",
449                                "behaviour. See the time crate's documentation for more information. ",
450                                "(https://time-rs.github.io/internal-api/time/index.html#feature-flags)"
451                            ))
452                            .format(&self.timestamps_format.unwrap_or(TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_OFFSET))
453                            .unwrap()
454                    ),
455                    Timestamps::Utc => format!(
456                        "{} ",
457                        OffsetDateTime::now_utc()
458                            .format(&self.timestamps_format.unwrap_or(TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_UTC))
459                            .unwrap()
460                    ),
461                    Timestamps::UtcOffset(offset) => format!(
462                        "{} ",
463                        OffsetDateTime::now_utc()
464                            .to_offset(offset)
465                            .format(&self.timestamps_format.unwrap_or(TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_OFFSET))
466                            .unwrap()
467                    ),
468                }
469
470                #[cfg(not(feature = "timestamps"))]
471                ""
472            };
473
474            let message = format!("{}{} [{}{}] {}", timestamp, level_string, target, thread, record.args());
475
476            #[cfg(not(feature = "stderr"))]
477            println!("{}", message);
478
479            #[cfg(feature = "stderr")]
480            eprintln!("{}", message);
481        }
482    }
483
484    fn flush(&self) {}
485}
486
487/// Configure the console to display colours.
488///
489/// This is only needed on Windows when using the 'colors' feature.
490/// It doesn't currently handle combining the 'colors' and 'stderr' features.
491#[cfg(all(windows, feature = "colors"))]
492pub fn set_up_windows_color_terminal() {
493    use std::io::{stdout, IsTerminal};
494
495    if stdout().is_terminal() {
496        unsafe {
497            use windows_sys::Win32::Foundation::INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
498            use windows_sys::Win32::System::Console::{
499                GetConsoleMode, GetStdHandle, SetConsoleMode, CONSOLE_MODE, ENABLE_VIRTUAL_TERMINAL_PROCESSING,
500                STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE,
501            };
502
503            let stdout = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
504
505            if stdout == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE {
506                return;
507            }
508
509            let mut mode: CONSOLE_MODE = 0;
510
511            if GetConsoleMode(stdout, &mut mode) == 0 {
512                return;
513            }
514
515            SetConsoleMode(stdout, mode | ENABLE_VIRTUAL_TERMINAL_PROCESSING);
516        }
517    }
518}
519
520/// The colored crate will disable colors when STDOUT is not a terminal. This method overrides this
521/// behaviour to check the status of STDERR instead.
522#[cfg(all(feature = "colored", feature = "stderr"))]
523fn use_stderr_for_colors() {
524    use std::io::{stderr, IsTerminal};
525
526    colored::control::set_override(stderr().is_terminal());
527}
528
529/// Initialise the logger with its default configuration.
530///
531/// Log messages will not be filtered.
532/// The `RUST_LOG` environment variable is not used.
533pub fn init() -> Result<(), SetLoggerError> {
534    SimpleLogger::new().init()
535}
536
537/// Initialise the logger with its default configuration.
538///
539/// Log messages will not be filtered.
540/// The `RUST_LOG` environment variable is not used.
541///
542/// This function is only available if the `timestamps` feature is enabled.
543#[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
544pub fn init_utc() -> Result<(), SetLoggerError> {
545    SimpleLogger::new().with_utc_timestamps().init()
546}
547
548/// Initialise the logger with the `RUST_LOG` environment variable.
549///
550/// Log messages will be filtered based on the `RUST_LOG` environment variable.
551pub fn init_with_env() -> Result<(), SetLoggerError> {
552    SimpleLogger::new().env().init()
553}
554
555/// Initialise the logger with a specific log level.
556///
557/// Log messages below the given [`Level`] will be filtered.
558/// The `RUST_LOG` environment variable is not used.
559pub fn init_with_level(level: Level) -> Result<(), SetLoggerError> {
560    SimpleLogger::new().with_level(level.to_level_filter()).init()
561}
562
563/// Use [`init_with_env`] instead.
564///
565/// This does the same as [`init_with_env`] but unwraps the result.
566#[deprecated(
567    since = "1.12.0",
568    note = "Use [`init_with_env`] instead, which does not unwrap the result. Will be removed in version 2.0.0."
569)]
570pub fn init_by_env() {
571    init_with_env().unwrap()
572}
573
574#[cfg(test)]
575mod test {
576    use super::*;
577
578    #[test]
579    fn test_module_levels_allowlist() {
580        let logger = SimpleLogger::new()
581            .with_level(LevelFilter::Off)
582            .with_module_level("my_crate", LevelFilter::Info);
583
584        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate", Level::Info)));
585        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate::module", Level::Info)));
586        assert!(!logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate::module", Level::Debug)));
587        assert!(!logger.enabled(&create_log("not_my_crate", Level::Debug)));
588        assert!(!logger.enabled(&create_log("not_my_crate::module", Level::Error)));
589    }
590
591    #[test]
592    fn test_module_levels_denylist() {
593        let logger = SimpleLogger::new()
594            .with_level(LevelFilter::Debug)
595            .with_module_level("my_crate", LevelFilter::Trace)
596            .with_module_level("chatty_dependency", LevelFilter::Info);
597
598        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate", Level::Info)));
599        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate", Level::Trace)));
600        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate::module", Level::Info)));
601        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("my_crate::module", Level::Trace)));
602        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("not_my_crate", Level::Debug)));
603        assert!(!logger.enabled(&create_log("not_my_crate::module", Level::Trace)));
604        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("chatty_dependency", Level::Info)));
605        assert!(!logger.enabled(&create_log("chatty_dependency", Level::Debug)));
606        assert!(!logger.enabled(&create_log("chatty_dependency::module", Level::Debug)));
607        assert!(logger.enabled(&create_log("chatty_dependency::module", Level::Warn)));
608    }
609
610    /// Test that enabled() looks for the most specific target.
611    #[test]
612    fn test_module_levels() {
613        let logger = SimpleLogger::new()
614            .with_level(LevelFilter::Off)
615            .with_module_level("a", LevelFilter::Off)
616            .with_module_level("a::b::c", LevelFilter::Off)
617            .with_module_level("a::b", LevelFilter::Info);
618
619        assert_eq!(logger.enabled(&create_log("a", Level::Info)), false);
620        assert_eq!(logger.enabled(&create_log("a::b", Level::Info)), true);
621        assert_eq!(logger.enabled(&create_log("a::b::c", Level::Info)), false);
622    }
623
624    #[test]
625    fn test_max_level() {
626        let builder = SimpleLogger::new();
627        assert_eq!(builder.max_level(), LevelFilter::Trace);
628    }
629
630    #[test]
631    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
632    fn test_timestamps_defaults() {
633        let builder = SimpleLogger::new();
634        assert!(builder.timestamps == Timestamps::Utc);
635    }
636
637    #[test]
638    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
639    #[allow(deprecated)]
640    fn test_with_timestamps() {
641        let builder = SimpleLogger::new().with_timestamps(false);
642        assert!(builder.timestamps == Timestamps::None);
643    }
644
645    #[test]
646    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
647    fn test_with_utc_timestamps() {
648        let builder = SimpleLogger::new().with_utc_timestamps();
649        assert!(builder.timestamps == Timestamps::Utc);
650    }
651
652    #[test]
653    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
654    fn test_with_local_timestamps() {
655        let builder = SimpleLogger::new().with_local_timestamps();
656        assert!(builder.timestamps == Timestamps::Local);
657    }
658
659    #[test]
660    #[cfg(feature = "timestamps")]
661    #[allow(deprecated)]
662    fn test_with_timestamps_format() {
663        let builder =
664            SimpleLogger::new().with_timestamp_format(time::macros::format_description!("[hour]:[minute]:[second]"));
665        assert!(builder.timestamps_format.is_some());
666    }
667
668    #[test]
669    #[cfg(feature = "colored")]
670    fn test_with_colors() {
671        let mut builder = SimpleLogger::new();
672        assert!(builder.colors == true);
673
674        builder = builder.with_colors(false);
675        assert!(builder.colors == false);
676    }
677
678    /// > And, without sorting, this would lead to all serde_json logs being treated as if they were configured to
679    /// > Error level instead of Trace (since to determine the logging level for target, the code finds first match in
680    /// > module_levels by a string prefix).
681    #[test]
682    fn test_issue_90() {
683        let logger = SimpleLogger::new()
684            .with_level(LevelFilter::Off)
685            .with_module_level("serde", LevelFilter::Error)
686            .with_module_level("serde_json", LevelFilter::Trace);
687
688        assert_eq!(logger.enabled(&create_log("serde", Level::Trace)), false);
689        assert_eq!(logger.enabled(&create_log("serde_json", Level::Trace)), true);
690    }
691
692    fn create_log(name: &str, level: Level) -> Metadata {
693        let mut builder = Metadata::builder();
694        builder.level(level);
695        builder.target(name);
696        builder.build()
697    }
698}
